name: The Bell Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived late Friday pm, parked easily. Pretty hall/ sitting room warmed by wood stove made good first impression. Friendly, efficient welcome, we had a beautiful bright room directly on riverside, linens and bed of very high quality, slept really well. Before that we had a seriously good dinner (included in chosen online rate). Staff are unobtrusive, well-trained and work hard to make everything just right. Sandwich itself is pure joy, an immaculate small town with fascinating history. Highly recommended for weekend break or longer.
reviews.title: Perfect winter weekend in a happy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really lovely hotel, I was surprised that it was only 3 star as it it was actually superior to some of the 4 star hotels that I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in a quintessential English village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reception area of the hotel is lovely, and has the most lovely cosy atmosphere with a log burner and lots of comfortable chairs and sofas in. The rooms were tastefully decorated, and were a good size.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself is in a great location and is clean and comfortable. Room 19, however, is above a barbecue restaurant and it's impossible to have the windows open. Bar food is not always available as they suspend it if the restaurant gets busy.
reviews.title: Good hotel but bar food not always available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel at the last minute as we were having dinner there with my eldest daughter & her fiance . What a pleasant stay! The staff were wonderful. Great food in the restaurant at reasonable prices. Spacious room with all mod cons. Will be staying here again. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Late booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Sandwich is a truely lovely small town. The Bell Hotel is very quiet, excellent service and nice staff. Rooms are modern (except bathroom where you still have one cold water tap separate from the hot water tap: we are in 2013 !).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant is fine cuisine, good choice of wines and beers. Beautiful dining room. The Bell is very pleasant to stay when its raining !
reviews.title: so - so experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A pleasant hotel, but with rooms that were too clairaudient. Our stay was negatively impacted by a child crying in a close-by room that kept waking us up every couple of hours.Rooms were clean and well appointed, good beds. Outstanding staff at breakfast.
reviews.title: Everything very good but a few constructive critisims.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: MEAL ***** i was so impressed with this.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was always delicious and the beds are the most comfortable I have had the pleasure of experiencing. Service was more than adequate and the place very clean. With a great view out over the river, we probably had the best of the rooms. Only complaint is that I couldn't see the TV properly due to the layout of the furniture and the four poster bed. That and all the taps for bath, sink etc working back to front! Overall, highly recommended.
reviews.title: A wonderful weekend stay in this classically Victorian hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night break in this lovely hotel. Ideally situated on the quayside, we were right in the middle of this mediaeval town. The weather was bitterly cold, but as we entered the hotel, there was a warm woodburner stove with comfy chairs and sofas to welcome us. The rooms were spotless with good facilities and all the staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. This was an ideal place to place to explore this part of Kent - Canterbury, Herne Bay and the White Cliffs of Dover all within easy reach. We had great value for money and have already recommended the Bell to friends. We were really looking forward to the seal watching boat trip but it was just too cold so an excellent excuse to return at a warmer time!
reviews.title: Brilliant Bell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Although there has been an hotel on the site for many years, it is the wonderful Victorian reception that strikes you. We had a lovely room over looking the Quay. It was a very cold couple of days and the room was not warm, but with very cosy bed linen and comfortable seating this was infinatly preferable to over heated central heating!
reviews.title: A victorian gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very helpful staff - even lending me a DVD when I showed interest inthe local history.
reviews.title: The hotel that takes you back into time.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had an excellent deal with Dinner, bed and breakfast, hotel restaurant was very good.
reviews.title: Charming and so friendly

description: A traditional hotel with a chic modern twist. Thirty-seven individually decorated ensuite bedrooms, a restaurant menu which varies with seasonal availability and a choice of two beautifully refurbished function rooms. The Bell Hotel Sandwich is the ideal choice as a leisure destination or as a venue for weddings, conferences and private events.Throughout the year, the Bell Hotel holds events and exhibitions to: support the local arts, to promote the produce of local and regional farmers and growers and to participate in Sandwich festivals and celebrations
